Package ohos.media.codec

Class CodecDescription

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.codec.CodecDescription

  • public final class CodecDescription
extends Object
    Provides methods for obtaining audio and video codec capabilities supported by the current device.
    Since:
    3
    See Also:
    CodecDescriptionList.getSupportedCodecs()
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#MEDIA

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public String getName​()
        Obtains the name of this Codec object.

        You can understand features of a codec through its name. The name can describe whether the codec is software or hardware, which MIME types it supports, and whether it is an encoder or decoder. For example, SoftwareAvcDecoder indicates a software decoder that supports the AVC format.

        Returns:
        Returns the codec name.
        Since:
        4

      • isEncoder

        public boolean isEncoder​()
        Checks whether this Codec is an encoder.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this Codec is an encoder; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • isAudio

        public boolean isAudio​()
        Checks whether this Codec is an audios codec.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this Codec is an audio codec; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • isSoftware

        public boolean isSoftware​()
        Checks whether this Codec is a software codec.

        Hardware codecs are generally provided by codec vendors.

        Returns:
        Returns true if this Codec is a software codec; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • getMimeTypes

        public String[] getMimeTypes​()
        Obtains the MIME types supported by this Codec.
        Returns:
        Returns the supported MIME types, which can be any keys defined in Format.
        Since:
        4

      • getSupportedFormat

        public Format getSupportedFormat​()
        Obtains the formats supported by this Codec.

        This method returns a Format object that contains keys in the media metadata. The keys include ranges of the audio sampling rate and bit rate, or ranges of the video height and width, bit rate, and frame rate.

        To obtain values of these keys, you need to use the Format.getObjectValue(java.lang.String) method and convert data types of return values.

        Format keys that can be obtained are as follows:

        Format.KEY_SAMPLE_RATE_SCOPE,Format.KEY_SAMPLE_RATE_LIST, Format.KEY_BIT_RATE_SCOPE, Format.KEY_FRAME_RATE_SCOPE, Format.KEY_HEIGHT_SCOPE, ohos.media.common.Format#KEY_WIGHT_SCOPE

        Returns:
        Returns the Format object.
        Since:
        4

      • isFormatSupported

        public boolean isFormatSupported​(Format format)
        Checks whether this Codec supports a specified format.
        Parameters:
        format - Indicates a media format, which may contain information such as the audio sampling rate or video height and width.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this Codec supports the format; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4
